fr.zcraft.quartzlib.tools.commands

Class PaginatedTextView<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.zcraft.quartzlib.tools.commands.PaginatedTextView<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - Data type to display.

    public abstract class PaginatedTextView<T>
extends Object
    An utility to send paginated chat views to players, mainly for commands.

      • setItemsPerPage

        public PaginatedTextView<T> setItemsPerPage(int itemsPerPage)
        Sets the amount of items per page.

        The default is the number of lines visible in a non-expanded chat window, by default, minus 2 (for header and footer).

        Parameters:
        itemsPerPage - The amount of items displayed per page.
        Returns:
        Instance for chaining.

      • setCurrentPage

        public PaginatedTextView<T> setCurrentPage(int page)
        Sets the current page to be displayed.
        Parameters:
        page - The page.
        Returns:
        Instance for chaining.

      • setDoNotPaginateForConsole

        public PaginatedTextView<T> setDoNotPaginateForConsole(boolean noPaginationForConsole)
        Sets if the console should receive a paginated view too. Defaults to true (displays the whole list at once).
        Parameters:
        noPaginationForConsole - true to disable pagination for console.
        Returns:
        Instance for chaining.

      • display

        public void display(org.bukkit.command.CommandSender receiver)
        Displays the paginated view page, as configured.
        Parameters:
        receiver - The receiver of the text view.

      • displayHeader

        protected void displayHeader(org.bukkit.command.CommandSender receiver)
        Displays a header.

        This method is called on every page before the items are displayed. You can access the view's properties through the protected methods like currentPage() or pagesCount().

        If this method is not overridden, no header will be displayed.

        Parameters:
        receiver - The receiver of the paginated view.

      • displayItem

        protected abstract void displayItem(org.bukkit.command.CommandSender receiver,
                                    T item)
        Displays an item.

        This method will be called for each displayed item.

        Parameters:
        receiver - The receiver of the paginated view.
        item - The item to be displayed.

      • displayFooter

        protected void displayFooter(org.bukkit.command.CommandSender receiver)
        Displays a footer.

        This method is called on every page when the items are displayed, so anything displayed inside will be shown after. You can access the view's properties through the protected methods like currentPage() or pagesCount().

        If this method is not overridden, the default implementation will print pagination links: a “previous” link, if we're not in the first page, the current page, and a “next” link if we're not on the last page.

        Parameters:
        receiver - The receiver of the paginated view.
        See Also:
        Method to override to fully use the default footer.

      • getCommandToPage

        protected String getCommandToPage(int page)
        Returns the command to be executed by the player to access the nth page, or null if not applicable.

        If you use the default footer, you should override this method. If this returns null, links to previous and next pages will not be displayed.

        Parameters:
        page - The page.
        Returns:
        The command to be executed to display the page.
